decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing cards that manipulate time, control opponents' actions, and disrupt their strategies. It focuses on creating a lock down on the game through counterspells, removal spells, and taxing effects like Propaganda and Ghostly Prison. Aminatou, the Fateshifter's ability to manipulate the top of the library and blink permanents is crucial in setting up advantageous draws and protecting key pieces. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and board control. The deck aims to out-value opponents through efficient card draw, disruptive plays, and ultimately winning the game through incremental advantage and control.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks to overwhelm the opponent quickly in a one-on-one matchup. With Questing Beast as the commander, the deck includes a wide range of green creatures with efficient mana acceleration such as Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise. By consistently developing a strong board presence and utilizing cards like Savage Swipe and Berserk, the deck aims to deal massive damage in the early turns of the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Collected Company and Vines of Vastwood to provide additional utility and flexibility in combat situations. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on a graveyard-based combo strategy with Old Rutstein as the commander. The key concept of the deck is to rapidly fill the graveyard with creatures and utilize reanimation spells like Animate Dead, Reanimate, and Necromancy to bring them back to the battlefield for powerful combos. Cards like Buried Alive, Entomb, and Demonic Tutor help search for key combo pieces like Razaketh, the Foulblooded, Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and Grist, the Hunger Tide. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Thoughtseize, Abrupt Decay, and Toxic Deluge to control the board and protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and win through powerful synergies and combos.
